                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Sisyphus Duncan Tweedy • 2 hours ago

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          If those little trolls can get into well-protected bank networks, as they have repeatedly done so recently, I fail to see how Disqus could even present a mediocre challenge to them.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          But yes, other forums being what they are, the Atlantic's forum is actually not that bad, at all. Even previously decent ones have degenerated into smoke filled biker (leftist and/or rightist) bars where its not worth one's time and effort to enter, unless one has an inordinate fondness for senseless howling and baying coupled with vicious brawls, without any hope of a reasonable outcome for anyone...

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Harvey Marx PW • 11 hours ago

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Chinese infrastructure in Africa is great if you need to drive from an oilfield to an oil refinery to an oil port while avoiding any major cities or trade routes. The locals are good enough to dig ditches but the Chinese require imported labor for precise, delicate work like basic construction. They do send a lot of money for housing development and you can see that it's working - the officials who collect it develop much larger houses.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      China is about as popular in Africa as the United Fruit Company was in Central America.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        see more
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • 5
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • •
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Reply
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • •
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Share ›
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Twitter
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Facebook
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Link
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        •
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • −
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • +
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Hanfeizi Harvey Marx • 6 hours ago

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          "he locals are good enough to dig ditches but the Chinese require imported labor for precise, delicate work like basic construction."

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Depends. Dambisa Moyo found out otherwise- in countries with underdeveloped labor forces, like Angola or Mozambique, this was generally true- Chinese employees either equalled or outnumbered African employees on projects. OTOH, in countries with more developed labor forces, like Senegal, Ghana or Botswana, Chinese were generally outnumbered by Africans 20:1 or 30:1. If the locals have the talents they need, which in the more educated nations they do, they hire them. If they don't, they import them.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          "They do send a lot of money for housing development and you can see that it's working - the officials who collect it develop much larger houses."

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Sub-Saharan African nations with a lot of Chinese investment are suddenly posting GDP growth rates in the 8-10% range. Why is that?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Chinese projects are denominated in RMB. You know what the great thing about RMB is? It's non-transferrable, and only useful for importing goods from China or construction contracts. Unlike Euros or Dollars, which can be smuggled offshore by elites, used to buy expensive luxury products or offshore real estate. So suddenly the influx of RMB is plugging the leaky sieve of "free trade", and igniting the local economies.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Check out Dambisa Moyo or Deborah Brautigam's works for the full story of why China's popularity has risen in Africa.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            see more
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • 2

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Sisyphus Avi • a day ago

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    It is not the weapons that demonstrate seriousness, but the willingness to use them... Not the same, at all. Some European countries have nuclear weapons, but no testicles to use them, ever. It is not the gun in the hand that will defend against an aggressor/attacker, but the will to pull the trigger...

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        After someone pulls the trigger, the big question is who wins? This is when the forces matter because one can try anything but one can't do the impossible.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Sisyphus Avi • a day ago

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            I am not sure what you mean, but my point was simple: the will to confront an aggressor is more important than anything else. I am much more concerned about that, than any new spending on weapons. We can spend all we have if we do not have the will to use those brand new very expensive and oh-so-impressive weapons. Confronting a bully has nothing to do with toys, but everything to do with the will to do it.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Avi Sisyphus • 18 hours ago

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Weapons and their quality and quantity are not toys. They are what determines the outcome. The outcome means, who wins and who loses. The losing side is often gone altogether. Where is the Axis now? Where is Biafra? Where is the last year's snow?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                When facing very large potential enemies, one needs to think about survival too, among other things.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • +
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Sisyphus Avi • 17 hours ago

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    You might have missed the two last military engagements we had been involved in, Iraq and Afghanistan, but I seriously doubt that there is anyone, including the Iraqis and the Afghans, who would doubt that we, the US, had by far the best and most weapons in either military theater, and I don't really think it is in doubt that, we did not accomplish the military aims we had when we got involved in either country. We were not willing to do what was needed to accomplish our missions we set out to accomplish at the beginning of the hostilities. I really don't think that the point I made has not been sufficiently demonstrated by the adduced examples. So, again, it is not the weapons at all, but the will to fight is what matters. We, the US, have both the qualitative and the quantitative edge over the Chinese when it comes to any military metric, save the number of troops, but that is immaterial in the naval theater we are discussing here; and we will maintain that qualitative and quantitative edge for many years to come - the will to fight I am not sure about at all...

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    mfw13 • 19 hours ago

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    China is the de-facto "bully" of East Asia, and bullies keep on bullying until someone stands up to them.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Avi • 18 hours ago

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        The American and Japanese forces used to be large in West Pacific, but now they are small. It is not that the US and Japan got shrunk, it is the other side that grew bigger.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        The only way to have peace is to have Western forces large enough to reliably deter aggression. This is not easy considering that China is much larger than the US in human resources and roughly the same size economically. Small countries when threatened rely on universal draft, which gives them large reserves in case of need.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Asia would be much more peaceful if American reservists were coming there once a year with reserve ships and aircraft to train and check what is going on there.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Bulos Qoqish • 17 hours ago

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Oh for God's sake. Here (sigh) yet again, we have another jingoistic article by America's chicken-hawk armchair warriors, whining about "how awful it is that China, might want to dominate the South CHINA Sea".

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Stop to think about that one, for a second or two. The CHINESE want to "dominate" the CHINA Sea... and America, a country located thousands of miles to the east, literally on the other side of the world, is fulminating with indignation at this "affront".

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                America -- the country that has, for over 200 years, famously (via the Monroe Doctrine) violently resisted the establishment of ANY non-American great power military relationship in the Western Hemisphere -- is now shrieking outrage at the idea that the Chinese, might actually want to "dominate" a body of water that is right off the coasts of Shanghai... while American nuclear-armed battle fleets cruise up and down that sea, just spoilin' for a fight.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                What, pray tell, do you think the American reaction would be, if the Chinese were, for example, sailing ships and submarines, all armed to the teeth with deliverable thermonuclear weapons, up and down the Sea of Cortes, or maybe off the coasts of Big Sur and Long Island?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Tell you what, America -- how about you withdraw your battle fleets from the South CHINA Sea, and the Chinese will promise not to start sailing the same, within spittin' distance of Malibu or Martha's Vineyard.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                How about that? Sound like a deal?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  see more

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    David Bulos Qoqish • 11 hours ago

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Let's actually come up with a useful analogy here, if we're going to use analogies.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Let us say that the United States is a rising power, expanding economically for the first time in about two centuries after being kicked around as a colonial battlefield by everyone with a navy for a long period of time. We HATE... let's say Colombia... because they invaded us a 70 years ago and we're good at holding a grudge. Futhermore, we regard Mexico, Canada, Cuba, Haiti, the Dominican Republic, and EVERYTHING ELSE around us as little more than wayward vassal states who'd best get the h*ll back in line, or else. We have irredentist claims on territory with almost every nation we border, and we throw our weight around, frankly bullying the hell out of anyone we think can't stand up to us. Furthermore, we have a domestic historical and media narrative that reads like a German propaganda piece in 1935, and an utterly opaque and somewhat unstable government that views foreign policy as a tool in maintaining domestic power. Do you think the global powers that be in this situation wouldn't regard us as a legitimate threat to peace in our corner of the world?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      albertocane • 15 hours ago

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      I was on Palawan in May. I spent a lot of time there as a matter of fact. I did not see any Korean, Vietnamese or Chinese signs anywhere. I'm sure there must have been a few I did not notice, but nothing like the author claims. The "rickshaws" he is talking about are called trikes, and they are ubiquitous in the Philippines.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      I'm assuming the author is simply making this up to add to spice to his story.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        see more

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        •
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • −
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • +
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          David • 13 hours ago

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          I find it depressing that this article only provides two or three paragraphs focused on the actual driver of Chinese foreign policy, that is, Chinese domestic politics.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          There are two core issues which drive foreign provocations under Xi's government. First, looking at his policies from the standpoint of intraparty factionalism: Quite frankly, Xi himself is NOT popular with the PLA. He's the leading figure in a faction of the CCP which seeks to curb (to some extent, anyway) the corruption and ridiculous abuse of authority. His initiatives and campaigns span the whole party, but the PLA's leadership represents a concentration of the sort of behavior he is attempting to reign in and they therefore intensely dislike him. This is compounded by the fact that his faction has its roots in the relatively prosperous and well-educated urban classes and its leaders are mostly descendants of former Party high-ups (hence the name "Princelings"), which means that the mostly dirt-poor, rural enlisted personnel and NCO's of the PLA also dislike (perhaps "hate" is a better word) him and his faction.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Thus, the PLA represents the only center of power in the Party with the strength and cohesiveness to upend his reform agenda, or, if the generals sense that he poses an existential threat to them and their privilege, to go beyond channels and remove or sideline him entirely. His pandering to nationalist sentiments in his foreign policy is at least in part driven by his need to keep the allegiance of the army's low- and mid-ranking personnel, who are generally poorly or moderately educated and thus rabidly nationalist. If he can keep them onboard, he can thwart any attempts by the PLA leadership to scuttle his anti-corruption drives or threaten his own person and leadership, making them fear that their sword will turn in their hand if they strike a blow with it.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Secondly, from a broader societal standpoint: Chinese economic growth over the last 30 years has provided sufficient "bread and circuses" to most of the urban population to keep them onboard with the program. In short, the current Chinese social contract with the urban populace reads: "you get a continually higher standard of living, and we keep political control." This is no longer sustainable in the cities as economic growth starts to slow and the massive inequalities and structural flaws which arose in those 30 years become apparent.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Yet, even most of the urban population is still not educated particularly well, and very few are cosmopolitan or open in the sense that many Americans and most Europeans are. Pandering to their nationalist sensibilities still *works*, and in the absence of continued double-digit economic growth, it can ensure urban support for continued Party rule despite them having shuffled political liberalization to the back burner and then turning off the stove. With the Party not only being assertive abroad but also prosecuting a moderately effective (if slow) crackdown on corruption at home, it can probably ensure relative urban stability and support for or acquiescence to continued Party rule.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          The rural picture is even more complicated; rural areas have seen only a fraction of the economic growth and development of urban ones, but because of that their educational systems lag severely and are much more propagandized. This means that the best ways to keep them in line are to play to their nationalist and xenophobic instincts and promote the image of the Party as a caring and kind uncle to the masses; the former is covered by Chinese belligerence abroad, especially towards traditional enemies that rural residents have been encouraged to hate by their own elders and a heavily propagandized reading of history, while the latter is fulfilled through the current anti-corruption campaigns.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          In short, Chinese belligerence abroad and the resulting poor relations with the neighbors is the price that Xi has to pay to find a way of replacing rapid economic growth as the primary support for Party legitimacy. Party rule will stand or fall on its ability to control its own corruption (for which Xi needs the support of the PLA's rank and file) and keep Chinese ultranationalists contented without actually provoking a war. Thus, we have saber rattling all over the Chinese periphery, because the leadership of the Party simply do not care about foreign opinion or goodwill at present. It is a luxury they cannot afford: their entire system is balanced on a knife's edge, and with it their power, and the only people with the power to affect it live within China's borders.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            see more

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Aidian Holder • 10 hours ago

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    1) This was a by the numbers recitation of the conventional wisdom. This article includes exactly one fact I -- a moderately interested layman -- didn't already know. Well, maybe two: I had no idea Vietnamese diplomats could be so droll.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    2) If the U.S. is going to have alliances in the region, we best be ready to throw down for them. Strategic ambiguity won't work wrt China.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    If we're willing to go to war to protect the Philippines, or Taiwan, or Japan then we need to be loud and clear about it; if we're not, then we shouldn't leave anyone with that impression.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Being seen as guaranteeing another nation's security when we're not willing to actually do it is a lose/lose position.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    3) This is reason 663 to not treat China like a regular country. This is a country that executes political prisoners to harvest their organs. China should be facing the sort of sanctions usually associated with Iran, North Korea, and Saddam's Iraq.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    That whole 'constructive engagement' approach is a huge failure (unless of course one supposes it's real purpose was to provide cover for companies seeking to make money by trading with China. And by trading with I mean exploiting the cheap labor supply. In that case it was a total success).

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            shawninchicago • 2 hours ago

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Both Southeastern Asian claimants and the US are using each other for their perspective gains; for the U.S. geopolitical leverage against China and for the smaller flies in the southeast Asian claimants and Japan (in East China Sea dispute with China) a perceived deterrent or protection in the case of Japan and the Philippines. The danger is that some small flies (like the Serb guy in Sarajevo) could cause mighty nations to go to self-destructive war like that in Europe in 1914 (which cost Britain superpower status and losing its grip on its colonies worldwide); that same thing could happen to the US as well albeit "exceptional" or "near chosen," if the US is not careful.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                overwhelmingly despise China and have multiple cultural ties to Japanese
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                culture.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Tokyo?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 next few Aircraft carriers we decommission should be gifted to Japan.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           GodknowsAll

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Frankly, Vietnam controls most of small islands in the South China Sea, Philippine the second, China the 3rd. We should respect the fact. Everyone knows U.S. tries to contain China to guarantee strategy advantage with all possible ways, it's not a problem. But the fact is quite different.
